metadata.title: CVE-2023-6228 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was found in the tiffcp utility distributed by the libtiff packagewhere a crafted TIFF file on processing may cause a heap-based bufferoverflow leads to an application crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.8
libtiff-tools - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.8
libtiff5 - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.8
libtiffxx5 - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-6ubuntu0.8').
libgeotiff package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
libtk-img package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
povray package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
